posts.post_content:
Posted By: steve yawitz
The thought has been percolating for a few months and after thinking about today's thread about how our collections evolve, I've decided the time has come. I'm still hanging onto my St. Louisans and a small handful of other favorites, but I now have about 175 or so T206's for sale. Everything from Abbaticchio to Wright, American Beauty to Tolstoi. (Uzit would have a nicer ring, I know, but I'm keeping it.)

Scans and prices are available here: [url]http://imageevent.com/yawie99/yawiesbaseballcards/19091911t206[/url]. All prices include shipping, so I can give a bit of a break on multi-card purchases. Almost all of the cards are raw, but many of them are crackouts and I guarantee all to grade. I can't promise specific grades, but I will offer refunds within 10 days if a card is not to your liking or within 90 days if a card is rejected by one of the big three grading companies.

Thanks for lookin',
Steve

Oh yeah, I'd also consider trades for St. Louis players with rare backs.

Adam

Thanks again,
Steve

Posted By: steve yawitz
Now that I've finished packaging up the first wave of purchases, I added a couple of SGC-graded Hall of Famers - Johnson and Speaker - and lowered prices on most of the remaining cards. About $2-5 on the commons, a bit more of a discount on the tougher backs. 

Thanks again,
Steve
